title: Sampler, 2003-14-21, early 17th century
medium:
Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: deflected element work, raised work, plaited stitches.
dimensions:
Frame H x W: 58.4 x 35.6 cm (23 x 14 in.)
H x W: 56.5 x 32.4 cm (22 1/4 x 12 3/4 in.) unframed
creditline: Gift of Myra and William H. Mathers
description: Spot sampler embroidered in blues, greens, yellows, gold and silver on a linen ground.  Geometric designs in rococo work, deflected element work, plaited braid stitch, chain stitch, running stitch, couching and detached needle looping.
